summary: The document focuses on the Assassination Records Review Board's decision to partially postpone the release of certain records related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), specifically staff payroll records, due to privacy concerns, including the redaction of Social Security numbers. It highlights Richard A. Sprague's roles and salary adjustments as Chief Counsel and Director, and includes a memorandum on payroll certification requirements for staff employees related to Members of Congress.
key_findings: The document's release was partially postponed to protect privacy, with specific redactions of Social Security numbers.
Richard A. Sprague's payroll records detail his appointment and salary adjustments as Chief Counsel and Director of the Select Committee on Assassinations.
A memorandum within the document specifies the need for staff employees to disclose any familial relationships to Members of Congress for payroll certification.
